title: Drawing, "Designs for Cookware and Kitchen Utensils", 1985–86
medium: Pen and black ink on typewriter paper, mounted on gray wove paper with tape
inscribed: Inscribed in black ink, text identifying pictured objects
provenance: Ward Bennett, by gift to David McCorkle, New York, NY
creditline: Gift of David McCorkle and Ernest Hood
description: Sheet of sketches including (from left to right across rows): (top row) faceted goblet, continuous-back chair, three spoons and a fork; (second row) ladle viewed in 3/4 perspective, two knives and a knife handle; (third row) handled bowl with conical cover, circular commode, square frying pan with cover; (bottom row) watch face, square covered pot with bale and straight handle, square bowl with separate cover.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Designs for Cookware and Kitchen Utensils", 1985–86.
1985–86. Pen and black ink on typewriter paper, mounted on gray wove paper with tape. Gift of David McCorkle and Ernest Hood. 2010-32-1.
